reviews.text: Nice place beautiful architecture. Can get tour around Catania from this place on the bus

Beautiful Jewel of Catania. Busy but great sights and food around the square. Has a taxi stand so you can get to any place from here. The start of Via Etnea and the shopping streets is off of the plaza as well.

It's a normal place as you can see duomo at any place of Italy. But the Piazza Duomo in Catania is so beautiful and gorgeous scenery, and many people have been visiting. Maybe you will across here during your journey.
Nice lively square
Beautiful building!

The unplanned visit to the castle and its museum has been an amazing surprise. We loved it. First of all the place is impressive (considering also that it has been surrounded by Lava in the 17th century). It is extremely well conserved (compared also to the city surrounding the castle) and it is clean. The building is massive, thick walls and very interesting to visit it and imagining life inside in the past. Now the full castle is a museum with some interesting things to see and admire. The only remark is that the refurbishment in some case , especially in the roof, has a bit too much changed the original building. Very nice surprise.

This is definitely worth visiting and you could get lucky if when you are here there is an art exhibition. The Castello is located in a beautiful piazza and everything around this place is really worth seeing. Before or after the visit here you could find a little chiosco or a small bar to sit and enjoy a drink or some food. Finding parking might be difficult so you might want to place a different way to get in this area. If you are staying in the historical city centre then it is just as easy and very pleasant to just walk here.

Ask any tour guide to to tell you the history of this castle including what I call the Lava Conquest, which forged most of the surrounding area. There are also some interesting carvings in the limestone so go check them out up close.

Nice castle and place to sit down and relaks. More quiet spot with few small restaurant around the castle. I did not enter the castle therefore dont know how were the exhibitions but even from outside the castle is quite photogenic to take few pictures. Close from city center.
I loved the museum.  It's like a hidden jewel in Catania.

A monastery in the center of Catania with a very beautiful Baroque architecture richly ornamented facade with very well combined elements with lavish friezes, tiles and exquisite sculptures. If you have time and the monastery works you must visit it!
Един манастир в центъра на Катания с много красива барокова архитектура богато орнаментирана фасада с много добре съчетани елементи с пищни фризове, плочки и изящни скулптори. Ако имате време и манастирът работи непременно го посетете!
Un monastero nel centro di Catania con una bellissima facciata in stile barocco riccamente decorato con elementi ben combinati con sontuosi fregi, piastrelle e squisite sculture. Se hai tempo e il monastero funziona, devi visitarlo!
Amazing guided tour. Our guide was extremely prepared and passioned about his job. Moreover he showed us parts of the monestry that we could have never discovered alone. Totally worth it!

10 minutes walk from the Cathedral square you find the Monastery of San Nicolò, a late baroque monument and one of the biggest Benedictine monastery in Europe. It is an example of architectonical integration of different styles through different epochs:  you can find a roman house, the cloisters and a roof garden.
Great place!!! A very good and funny tour guide...we loved the place.a university housed in such a grandiose building...is just the first motive to fall in love with studying!

Half the building is a college/university and the other half is a church and tourist spot. Very interesting architecture on the college side and a more traditional interior and exterior on the tourist side. You can climb a spiral staircase to go to the roof and look out over all of Catania. You can also see mount Etna. Due to it being very cloudy we only partially and very briefly saw mount Etna. Very impressive building and view.

A monastery in the center of Catania with a very beautiful Baroque architecture richly ornamented facade with very well combined elements with lavish friezes, tiles and exquisite sculptures. If you have time and the monastery works you must visit it!
Един манастир в центъра на Катания с много красива барокова архитектура богато орнаментирана фасада с много добре съчетани елементи с пищни фризове, плочки и изящни скулптори. Ако имате време и манастирът работи непременно го посетете!
Un monastero nel centro di Catania con una bellissima facciata in stile barocco riccamente decorato con elementi ben combinati con sontuosi fregi, piastrelle e squisite sculture. Se hai tempo e il monastero funziona, devi visitarlo!
Amazing guided tour. Our guide was extremely prepared and passioned about his job. Moreover he showed us parts of the monestry that we could have never discovered alone. Totally worth it!

10 minutes walk from the Cathedral square you find the Monastery of San Nicolò, a late baroque monument and one of the biggest Benedictine monastery in Europe. It is an example of architectonical integration of different styles through different epochs:  you can find a roman house, the cloisters and a roof garden.
Great place!!! A very good and funny tour guide...we loved the place.a university housed in such a grandiose building...is just the first motive to fall in love with studying!

Half the building is a college/university and the other half is a church and tourist spot. Very interesting architecture on the college side and a more traditional interior and exterior on the tourist side. You can climb a spiral staircase to go to the roof and look out over all of Catania. You can also see mount Etna. Due to it being very cloudy we only partially and very briefly saw mount Etna. Very impressive building and view.
We enjoyed a superb tour of the church and the accessible areas of the convent with an audio guide. A beautiful example of Sicilian Baroque.
Very good tour of church and convent
Very nice
If only people would respect them more.
Great place to see, only 5€ entry
It's truly a beautiful and impressive old Aristocratic building with beautifully decorated rooms and old pictures portraying members of the Biscari family who were powerful Princeton the past.
Unique in the word..amazing..
Was not impresed, just a castle built on lava nothing special apart from the views
Very different palace. At first quite dark, not glamourous at all until one enters the dance hall. Beautiful, unusual staircase on one side.

Very nice place for hosting lunches and dinners. This is a former home of a prince. Visiting the main building, you are able to see at least four halls, which are decorated with old paintings and furnitures from past centuries.

If you are planning to set or attending an event here, then you should know in advance that there is no air conditioning inside. It could be particularly painful when there are more than 150 people inside.

A unique archaeological site, located in the oldest part of the City, which you can visit for free. 
A place to visit if you want to learn more about the history of Catania.
Neat little archaeogical complex. Needs some more interpretation in it's presentation to the public but it is free and worth a visit. It's very easy to find but not well known.

A very unusual domed building, now completely engulfed by Catanese sprawl. If you're there on one of the five days per week that the complex is closed, it's still worthwhile to walk around the sides of the site that are accessible from the street.
It's free and nice to look at if you want to see an old bathhouse.
From roman baths to catholic church: this place has many things to tell. The touristic guides will lead you through the history of the building and the city.
Fabulous place to visit for exhibitions, which are all beautifully arranged. This time we saw an excellent Toulouse Lautrec exhibition. Full marks. Go there to see ANYTHING they show

Beautiful Baroque style palace but not recently renovated. Cultural events are taking place now.
Bellissimo palazzo in stile barocco ma non recentemente rinnovato. Gli eventi culturali si stanno svolgendo ora.
Красив дворец в бароков стил, но скоро не е реновиран. Сега в него се провеждат културни събития.
Great exhibit! I also caught the African sicilian performance and it was amazing!
Wonderful pslazzo in centre of Catania.
The place is new / old. The entertainment held by LIONS CLUB CATANIA BELLINI, was confusing in the least! Not sure if it was Bellini or Mozart contest. Wish they were clearer. And the winner...mmmm

This place is a piece of Sicilian's history, It was established in 1936, if you want the very best of the best you need to come here, the pasticcini are amazing and the coffee is one of the best iv had in Sicily, highly reccomend It.
Coffee was good and the food interesting. We have never tried something like this before. Worth a try! And great location.
Great coffee and the freshest and yummiest cassatina aka small Cassata.
Great bar in the center of the city. Very delicious arancini, cannoli. You must visit it and taste it (for sure))
Always extremely good and the best coffee in via etnea ❤
Ottimo ristorante
Primi e secondi piatti molto buoni. Frittate sconsigliatissime.
